pull.title: fs: consistently use fsbridge:: for ifstream / ofstream
pull.body: Two of these changes are part of #20744, but are ok to do now, and reduce the diff that will eventually need to be reviewed in that PR. See commit messages for details.

verification.payload:
tree 8b3d30b0dc26562bec73aeaf59a73c44f2df1dd7
parent 7551ae81e1a9d5bf14b434bce7528ac000d8afe1
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640333942 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640334949 +0800

fs: consistently use fsbridge for {i,o}fstream

Part of #20744, but this can be done now, and will simplify the diff.

events.message:
fs: consistently use fsbridge for {i,o}fstream

Part of #20744, but this can be done now, and will simplify the diff.

verification.payload:
tree 761b42b7db3d029737863fba2b83fffa9f9e1408
parent 2da5bc557de6d606389808bfd8050d389577540c
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640334278 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640334953 +0800

fs: add missing <cassert> include

This is needed to prevent compilation failures once boost is removed,
however is still correct to include now, and reduces the diff in #20744.

<string> is extracted from the defines because it is used for Windows
and non-Windows code, i.e get_filesystem_error_message().

events.body: Please clarify if this changes behavior in any way or if this is a refactor.

https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6421734977961984:
```
bench/bench.cpp: In function ‘void {anonymous}::GenerateTemplateResults(const std::vector<ankerl::nanobench::Result>&, const string&, const char*)’:
bench/bench.cpp:30:37: error: use of deleted function ‘fs::path::path(std::string)’
   30 |     fsbridge::ofstream fout{filename};
      |                                     ^
In file included from ./test/util/setup_common.h:9,
                 from bench/bench.cpp:7:
./fs.h:50:5: note: declared here
   50 |     path(std::string) = delete;
      |     ^~~~
make[2]: *** [Makefile:13538: bench/bench_bitcoin-bench.o] Error 1
```

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#20744](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20744) (Use std::filesystem. Remove Boost Filesystem & System by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Use std::filesystem. Remove Boost Filesystem & System
issue.body:
This PR replaces our Boost Filesystem usage with [`std::filesystem`](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/filesystem) and includes dropping Boost System as a dependency. It includes a squashed down version of the changes from #19245. 

[A macro has been added](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7002c4ade0148c3273659208ae517b79822b289d), modelling how we check for `-latomic` to facilitate linking with `-lstdc++fs` when required. This is  ~GCC < 9.1 & ~Clang < 9.0, however not always. i.e you could be using Clang 7 on top of a GCC 9 installation (i.e Ubuntu Focal) and use `<filesystem>` without passing any additional arguments. I've tested this with GCC 8 on Bionic, Clang 7 on Focal & with Apple Clang 12.0.0 on macOS.

Guix build:

events.body: Closing as this is going in as part of #20744.

Not sure why this was closed?

It looks like the CI failure hinted at a bug that needs fixup? In all other places where strings from the command line are converted to paths, `PathFromString` is used, but not here in bench.

> Not sure why this was closed?

It's part of #20744.
I think it might be worthwhile to fix the presumed bug in bench before 20744, in which case this should compile and can also be done before 20744?
Ok. I had deleted the branch, but can open a new PR.

issue.title: fs: consistently use fsbridge:: for ifstream / ofstream
issue.body: These changes are part of #20744, but are also ok to do now, and reduce the diff in that PR. See commit messages for details. Revived from #23857.
